div.p: Let's solve this math problem step-by-step:
If a train leaves a station at 9 AM and travels at a speed of 60 miles per hour, how far will it have traveled by 11 AM?

Step 1: Determine the travel time.
The train leaves at 9 AM and arrives at 11 AM.
So, the train travels for 2 hours.

Step 2: Calculate the distance traveled.
We know:

p.strong: So, the train will have traveled 120 miles by 11 AM.

div.div:
Problem: How can we reduce plastic pollution in oceans?
1. identify the source of plastic pollution:
Single-use plastics
Improper waste disposal
Industrial waste2. Reduce plastic consumption
Encourage the use of reusable items
Support plastic-free initiatives
Implement plastic bans3. Improve waste management:
Invest in recycling infrastructure
Promote proper waste disposal practices
Implement stricter regulations on waste management4. Clean up existing pollution:
Organize beach clean-up drives
Develop advanced technologies for ocean cleanup
Support organizations dedicated to ocean conservation
By breaking down the problem into smaller, more manageable subproblems, the model can generate more comprehensive and effective solutions.

switch.text: Problem: How can we reduce plastic pollution in oceans?...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 738px; height: 1px; padding-top: 915px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
RAG
(Retrieval Augmented Generation)
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is a technique that combines the power of large language models (LLMs) with external knowledge bases.
Imagine you have a super smart AI, but it doesn't know everything. RAG helps this AI by giving it access to a vast library of information. When you ask the AI a question, it first searches this library for relevant information. Then, it uses its intelligence to understand the information and provide a comprehensive and informative answer.
Here's a simple example:
Let's say you ask the AI, "What is the capital of France?"
Retrieval: The AI searches its knowledge base and finds the relevant information: "Paris is the capital of France."
Generation: The AI processes this information and generates a response: "The capital of France is Paris."
By using RAG, AI models can provide more accurate and informative responses, making them even more helpful and versatile.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 372px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 15px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: Prompt engineering is the art of crafting effective prompts to guide large language models (LLMs) and generate desired outputs. It involves understanding how LLMs process information and using specific techniques to optimize their responses. By carefully constructing prompts, you can control the quality, relevance, and creativity of the generated content.
